com.google.devtools.simple.runtime.components
Class SpriteComponent

java.lang.Object
  com.google.devtools.simple.runtime.components.VisibleComponent
      com.google.devtools.simple.runtime.components.SpriteComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
AlarmHandler, Component
Direct Known Subclasses:
Sprite
public abstract class SpriteComponent
extends VisibleComponent
implements AlarmHandler

Device-independent abstract implementation of sprites. While the Simple programmer sees the x- and y-coordinates as integers, they are maintained internally as doubles so fractional changes (caused by multiplying the speed by a cosine or sine value) have the chance to add up.

Method Detail

requestEvent

protected abstract void requestEvent(SpriteComponent sprite,
                                     java.lang.String eventName,
                                     java.lang.Object... args)
Requests a dispatch for the specified event. The implementing class is responsible for making sure that event handlers run with serial semantics, e.g., appear atomic relative to each other.

Parameters:
sprite - the instance on which the event takes place
eventName - the name of the event
args - the arguments to the event handler

EdgeReached

public void EdgeReached(int edge)
Event handler called when the sprite reaches an edge of the screen. If Bounce is then called with that edge, the sprite will appear to bounce off of the edge it reached.

Touched

public void Touched(float x,
                    float y)
Handler for Touched events.

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate of touched point
y - y-coordinate of touched point

Dragged

public void Dragged(float startX,
                    float startY,
                    float prevX,
                    float prevY,
                    float currentX,
                    float currentY)
Handler for Dragged events. On all calls, the starting coordinates are where the screen was first touched, and the "current" coordinates describe the endpoint of the current line segment. On the first call within a given drag, the "previous" coordinates are the same as the starting coordinates; subsequently, they are the "current" coordinates from the prior call. Note that the Sprite won't actually move anywhere in response to the Dragged event unless MoveTo is specifically called.

Parameters:
startX - the starting x-coordinate
startY - the starting y-coordinate
prevX - the previous x-coordinate (possibly equal to startX)
prevY - the previous y-coordinate (possibly equal to startY)
currentX - the current x-coordinate
currentY - the current y-coordinate

Interval

public abstract int Interval()
Interval property getter method.

Returns:
timer interval in ms

Interval

public abstract void Interval(int interval)
Interval property setter method: sets the interval between timer events.

Parameters:
interval - timer interval in ms

Enabled

public abstract boolean Enabled()
Enabled property getter method.

Returns:
true indicates a running timer, false a stopped timer

Enabled

public abstract void Enabled(boolean enabled)
Enabled property setter method: starts or stops the timer.

Parameters:
enabled - true starts the timer, false stops it

Heading

public void Heading(double user_heading)
Sets heading in which sprite should move. In addition to changing the local variables userHeading and heading, this sets headingCos, headingSin, and headingRadians.

Parameters:
user_heading - degrees above the positive x-axis

Heading

public double Heading()
Returns the heading of the sprite.

Returns:
degrees above the positive x-axis

PointTowards

public void PointTowards(SpriteComponent target)
Turns this sprite to point towards a given other sprite.

Parameters:
target - the other sprite to point towards

Speed

public void Speed(float speed)
Sets the speed with which this sprite should move.

Parameters:
speed - the magnitude (in pixels) to move every interval milliseconds

Speed

public float Speed()
Gets the speed with which this sprite moves.

Returns:
the magnitude (in pixels) the sprite moves every interval milliseconds.

registerChange

public void registerChange()
Responds to a move or change of this sprite by checking for any consequences (such as hitting the edge of the canvas), and notifying the component that has responsibility for handling the change (e.g., the containing canvas, which will redraw the sprite and check for collisions). The implementation here checks for hitting the edge of the canvas. Subclasses should override this method to notify the containing canvas.

MoveTo

public void MoveTo(double x,
                   double y)
Moves sprite directly to specified point.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate
y - the y-coordinate

updateCoordinates

protected void updateCoordinates()
Updates the x- and y-coordinates based on the heading and speed. The caller is responsible for calling registerChange().

hitEdge

protected abstract int hitEdge()
Specifies what edge of the canvas has been hit by the SpriteComponent, if any, moving the sprite back in bounds.

Returns:
Component.DIRECTION_NONE if no edge has been hit, or a direction (e.g., Component.DIRECTION_NORTHEAST) if that edge of the canvas has been hit

hitEdge

protected final int hitEdge(int canvasWidth,
                            int canvasHeight)

getBoundingBox

public BoundingBox getBoundingBox(int border)
Provides the bounding box for this sprite. Modifying the returned value does not affect the sprite.

Parameters:
border - the number of pixels outside the sprite to include in the bounding box
Returns:
the bounding box for this sprite

colliding

public static boolean colliding(SpriteComponent sprite1,
                                SpriteComponent sprite2)
Determines whether two sprites are in collision. Note that we cannot merely see whether the rectangular regions around each intersect, since some types of sprite, such as BallSprite, are not rectangular.

Parameters:
sprite1 - one sprite
sprite2 - another sprite
Returns:
true if they are in collision, false otherwise

intersectsWith

public boolean intersectsWith(BoundingBox rect)
Determines whether this sprite intersects with the given rectangle.

Parameters:
rect - the rectangle
Returns:
true if they intersect, false otherwise

containsPoint

public boolean containsPoint(double qx,
                             double qy)
Indicates whether the specified point is contained by this sprite. Subclasses of Sprite that are not rectangular should override this method.

Parameters:
qx - the x-coordinate
qy - the y-coordinate
Returns:
whether (qx, qy) falls within this sprite

MoveIntoBounds

public abstract void MoveIntoBounds()
Moves the sprite back in bounds if part of it extends out of bounds, having no effect otherwise. If the sprite is too wide to fit on the canvas, this aligns the left side of the sprite with the left side of the canvas. If the sprite is too tall to fit on the canvas, this aligns the top side of the sprite with the top side of the canvas.

moveIntoBounds

protected final void moveIntoBounds(int canvasWidth,
                                    int canvasHeight)

Bounce

public void Bounce(int edge)
Makes this sprite bounce, as if off of a wall by changing the heading (unless the sprite is not traveling toward the specified direction). This also calls MoveIntoBounds() in case the sprite is out of bounds.

Parameters:
edge - the direction of the object (real or imaginary) to bounce off of; this should be one of Component.DIRECTION_NORTH, Component.DIRECTION_NORTHEAST, Component.DIRECTION_EAST, Component.DIRECTION_SOUTHEAST, Component.DIRECTION_SOUTH, Component.DIRECTION_SOUTHWEST, Component.DIRECTION_WEST, or Component.DIRECTION_NORTHWEST.

X

public void X(double x)

X

public double X()

public void Y(double y)

Y

public double Y()

Visible

public boolean Visible()
Gets whether sprite is visible.

Returns:
true if the sprite is visible, false otherwise

Visible

public void Visible(boolean visible)
Sets whether sprite should be visible.

Parameters:
visible - true if the sprite should be visible; false otherwise.
